pages.title: Enchanting
pages.text: Besides using an $(key)Enchanting Table$(), you can also craft enchanted books or enchant items through $(mage/infusion)Enchantment Infusion$().$(br2)$(italic)The former requires some luck, while the latter requires some money.$()

pages.title: Disenchanting
pages.text: Place enchanted $(key)equipment$() and a blank $(key)book$() in a $(key)Grindstone$() to $(bold)transfer$() the enchantments onto the $(key)book$().$(br2)Or, place an $(key)enchanted book$() with multiple enchantments and a blank $(key)book$() in a $(key)Grindstone$() to $(bold)transfer$() one of its enchantments onto the blank $(key)book$().

pages.title: Enchanting Restrictions
pages.text: $(welcome/emi#ru)Check uses$() on an $(key)enchanted book$() to see its $(bold)applicable items$() and $(bold)conflicting enchantments$().$(br2)In addition, $(bold)spell-power enchantments$() $(t:e.g. Sunfire, Soulfrost, Energize) require the item to have a corresponding $(bold)Spell Power bonus$() for that school, otherwise it cannot be enchanted.

The $(key)Book Of Omniscience$() can be converted into almost any enchantment. You can only use it after unlocking the $(boss/t1/dragon)End Stage$().$(br2)The only way to obtain the $(key)Book Of Omniscience$() is to convert a large amount of $(bold)enchantments$() $(t:enchanted books or enchanted items) through $(util/illusion)Illusion$().
